jobber.translation[0].definitions[0].def: someone whose job is buying and selling stocks and shares
jobber.translation[1].definitions[0].def: in Britain before the BIG BANG, someone whose job was to buy stocks and shares in a particular area of the market, dealing only with BROKERs or with other jobbers, not directly with investors. Now any person whose job is buying and selling stocks and shares can deal directly with investors or other dealers
jobber.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The distinction between brokers and jobbers has disappeared.
jobber.translation[1].definitions[1].def: someone who buys a product from a company and then sells it to a customer at a higher price
jobber.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The distribution system includes the oil companies, middlemen known as jobbers and the gas stations themselves.
